summary: The "Augmenting Compatibility and Competition by Enabling Service Switching Act of 2025" (ACCESS Act) aims to promote competition and reduce consumer switching costs in online communications. The bill mandates large communication platforms to facilitate user data portability and interoperability with competing services. It defines key terms like "large communications platform," "interoperability interface," and  "custodial third-party agent."  It tasks the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) with enforcement and regulation, and establishes duties and guidelines for platforms, competing providers and custodial agents. The bill also includes exemptions for services that do not generate income from user data.
